name: produndle
description: A tool that handles compressing, bundling, and unpacking production node_modules dependencies that you want to store in source control
author: Brian Zalewski <brian@megabyte.space> (https://megabyte.space)

scripts.bump: npm run build && npm version patch --no-commit-hooks --no-git-tag-version --force && npm publish
scripts.prepare: npm run start && (test -f Taskfile.yml && task npm:prepare) || true

blueprint.description: A tool that handles compressing, bundling, and unpacking production node_modules dependencies that you want to store in source control
blueprint.name: Produndle
blueprint.overview: **Produndle** is a project that brings [pac](https://www.npmjs.com/package/pac) back to life (and support modern versions of Node.js. To achieve the fastest deployments possible, the production `node_modules/` (not devDependencies or any of that optional stuff) can be compressed by running `produndle pack` and stored in source control. Then, when deployment time comes all you have to do is uncompress or run `produndle unpack`. This works well when you also run [node-prune](https://github.com/tj/node-prune) on your `node_modules/` folder, before compressing your production dependencies. We even take it a step further in some cases and create global shared configurations for libraries like [ESLint](https://github.com/ProfessorManhattan/eslint-config-strict-mode) and [Prettier](https://github.com/ProfessorManhattan/prettier-config-sexy-mode) that dynamically load their plugins into `node_modules/` by downloading compressed plugins from source control without having to run `npm install`. We fuss about the performance of our `node_modules/` installation time because it is often a bottleneck.
blueprint.title: Bundle Your Production Dependencies with Produndle

descriptions.build: Builds the project using the build command specified under scripts in package.json
descriptions.bump: Used to quickly build, increase the package.json version, and publish the package
descriptions.commit: If unsure, use this task to commit your code so that it adheres to our commit rules
descriptions.fix: Run auto-fixing with all available auto-fixers
descriptions.help: Display the Bodega Taskfile.yml interactive help menu
descriptions.lint: Lint the project with all available linters
descriptions.preload: Preload the operating system with commonly used libraries and tools
descriptions.prepare: A hook triggered by running npm install that runs logic such as installing pre-commit hooks
descriptions.release: Publish the software to all supported channels using semantic-release
descriptions.repair: Fixes basic issues in projects that are having trouble running basic commands like 'task start'
descriptions.start: Entrypoint for new developers that installs requirements and then runs 'task start'
descriptions.test: Runs the appropriate test logic by running the test command defined under scripts in package.json
descriptions.unpack: Populates production node_modules from compressed copies saved in the .modules/ folder
descriptions.update: Update and refresh the repository with upstream changes and templated parts
